title: Robust Gross Domestic Product
description: In 2023, Iran's GDP reached an impressive 143 trillion LCU, showcasing its economic strength on a global scale.

title: High Gross National Income
description: Iran's GNI in 2023 stood at 142.87 trillion LCU, reflecting its substantial income generation capabilities.

title: Significant Gross Domestic Savings
description: In 2023, Iran's gross domestic savings amounted to 52.67 trillion LCU, indicating a strong savings culture.

title: High Value in Services Sector
description: The services sector in Iran contributed 69.04 trillion LCU to the economy in 2023, highlighting its importance.

title: Strong Manufacturing Sector
description: Iran's manufacturing sector added 27.77 trillion LCU to the economy in 2023, showcasing industrial strength.

title: High Net Foreign Assets
description: In 2016, Iran's net foreign assets were valued at 2.47 quadrillion LCU, indicating a strong external financial position.

title: High Government Expenditure
description: Iran's government final consumption expenditure reached 18.42 trillion LCU in 2023, reflecting significant public sector investment.

title: High Household Consumption
description: Household consumption expenditure in Iran was 71.94 trillion LCU in 2023, indicating a robust domestic market.

title: High Imports of Goods and Services
description: Iran imported goods and services worth 40.02 trillion LCU in 2023, reflecting a high level of international trade.

title: High Exports of Goods and Services
description: In 2023, Iran exported goods and services valued at 34.62 trillion LCU, showcasing its export capabilities.

title: High Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: In 2017, Iran achieved a net intake rate of 99.98% for females in grade 1, reflecting strong educational enrollment.

title: High Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: In 2017, Iran's net intake rate for grade 1 was 99.98%, indicating near-universal primary education enrollment.

title: Lowest External Debt as Percentage of GNI
description: In 2023, Iran's external debt was only 2.45% of its Gross National Income, one of the lowest ratios globally, indicating a strong position in managing external liabilities.

title: Minimal Debt Service Burden
description: Iran's total debt service was just 0.34% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income in 2023, showcasing its efficient debt management strategies.

title: Low Present Value of External Debt
description: In 2023, the present value of Iran's external debt was only 1.67% of its GNI, reflecting a sustainable debt profile.

title: Significant External Balance Deficit
description: Iran faced a substantial external balance deficit of -5,403,951,000,000,000 LCU in 2023, indicating challenges in its trade and service balance.

title: High Discrepancy in GDP Expenditure Estimates
description: In 2022, Iran had a GDP expenditure discrepancy of -195,940,706,686,100 LCU, suggesting potential inefficiencies in economic reporting or expenditure management.

title: Low Female Labor Force with Intermediate Education
description: Only 8.78% of Iran's female working-age population had intermediate education in 2022, highlighting a gap in educational attainment among women.

title: Minimal Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2022, Iran received a negligible amount of bilateral aid from Luxembourg, totaling approximately $10,000, indicating limited financial support from this donor.

title: Low Terms of Trade Adjustment
description: Iran's terms of trade adjustment was -1,585,600,410,845,230 LCU in 2023, reflecting challenges in its trade conditions and economic adjustments.
